Class Workflow

  • entity.Workflow
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Bean, Retireable

    public class Workflow
implements Bean, Retireable

      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      WorkflowActiveState ActiveState
      Specific state of this workflow if active (e.g. running, waitmanual, waitactivity).
      WorkflowWorkItem ActiveWorkflowWorkItem
      This will find the active work item for this workflow if it exists
      Activity[] Activities
      Active activities on this workflow.

      Returns a list of available timeouts

      Auto-incremented object version

      What workflow called this workflow
      Date CreateTime
      Timestamp when the object was created
      User CreateUser
      User who created the object
      WorkflowActionType CurrentAction
      What action is the Workflow currently trying to take?
      String CurrentBranch
      ID of the branch the workflow is currently trying to execute.
      String CurrentStep
      ID of the workflow's current step.
      Date DateTime
      Gets the current time, which is normally the time from the SystemClock, but will be the value of the "testTime" field if the Workflow's handler is internal
      ILocale DefaultLanguage
      Will return the default language from this workflow. Note that this is used by WorkflowEngine to set the locale prior to executing the workflow processing in advance.
      ILocale DefaultLocale
      Will return the default locale from this workflow. Note that this is used by WorkflowEngine to set the locale prior to executing the workflow processing in advance.
      Date EnteredStep
      Time when the Workflow entered the current step
      String ForceTimeoutBranch
      ID of the next workflow timeout branch to take.
      WorkflowHandler Handler
      What infrastructure handles this Workflow?
      Key ID
      Internally managed primary key
      WorkflowLogEntry[] Log
      Log of what work this Workflow has performed
      Integer LogEntryCounter
      Counter for assigning a sort order to log entries
      Message Message
      Integration message associated with this workflow
      MessageHistory MessageHistory
      Completed integration message associated with this workflow
      String PreviousStep
      ID of the step the workflow was on BEFORE the current step.
      Integer ProcessVersion
      Version of the workflow process used, if this uses an internal workflow
      String PublicID
      ID or primary key of the row in the external system to which this row is mapped
      Long RetiredValue
      Whether the entity is still in use. A value of 0 means that the entity is not retired. If the entity is retired from active use, this field has a non-zero value equal to the entity's ID. Once an entity is retired, it should not be unretired.
      WorkflowState State
      State of this workflow (e.g., 'started', 'completed', etc.)
      Long StepExecTime
      Total system time spent actively processing the current step, in millis. Does not include time spent waiting on triggers, activities, or timeouts
      Workflow[] SubFlows
      Gets all subflows created by the "createSubFlow" method
      SubWorkflows[] SubWorkflowsArray
      Workflow Subtype
      Identifies a particular subtype within a supertype table; each subtype of a supertype has its own unique subtype value
      Date TestTime
      What time the Workflow thinks it is
      Date TimeoutTime
      Date/time when current step will time out.
      WorkflowTriggerKey TriggerInvoked
      Marks the key of a Trigger that was invoked, or null
      Date UpdateTime
      Timestamp when the object was last updated
      User UpdateUser
      User who last updated the object

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addToActivities(Activity element)
      void addToLog(WorkflowLogEntry element)
      void advance()
      Handle the resuming of the Indicates to the workflow that it is okay to proceed. It is similiar to resume, except that it does nothing if the workflow is in an error state.
      KeyableBean copy()
      Makes a copy of the current bean. This method will also deep copy all owned arrays in this object graph.
      KeyableBean copy(block(field:IEntityPropertyInfo):Boolean shouldCopy)
      Makes a copy of the current bean. This method will also deep copy all properties where shouldCopy() returns true. For example, the above copy method simply calls this method with the block: \ field ->field typeis IArrayPropertyInfo && field.Owned
      Workflow createSubFlow(Workflow type, Integer version)
      Create and start a subflow of the specified version. If the subflow has a common super type, the common super type's properties are copied into the new workflow.
      Workflow createSubFlow(Workflow type)
      Create and start a subflow. If the subflow has a common super type, the common super type's properties are copied into the new workflow.
      IQueryBeanResult<WorkflowWorkItem> findWorkflowWorkItems()
      This will find the active work item for this workflow if it exists

      Collection<T> getRemovedArrayElements(IPropertyReference<KeyableBean,Object[]> ref)
      Delegates to getRemovedArrayElements(IArrayPropertyInfo), using the referenced property literal.
      Workflow instantiateSubFlow(Workflow type)
      Create but do not start a subflow of the specified version. After you have finished populating the properties of the workflow you should either start or startAsynchronously (with the apporpiate version if desired) If the subflow has a common super type, the common super type's properties are copied into the new workflow.
      void invokeTrigger(WorkflowTriggerKey triggerKey, boolean synchronous)
      Like {@link #invokeTrigger(WorkflowTriggerKey)} but with an extra parameter to control whether the trigger should be evaluated synchronously (i.e. immediately in the current bundle) or else in the background.
      void invokeTrigger(WorkflowTriggerKey triggerKey)
      Tries to invoke a "manual trigger" in the Workflow, meaning an action initiated from outside the Workflow itself. In the case of an external Workflow, this will just update the "triggerInvoked" field; in the case of an internal Workflow it will set the "triggerInvoked" field and advance the workflow synchronously. This is equivalent to calling invokeTrigger(triggerKey, true)
      boolean isArrayElementAddedOrRemoved(IPropertyReference<KeyableBean,Object[]> ref)
      Delegates to isArrayElementAddedOrRemoved(IArrayPropertyInfo), using the referenced property literal.
      boolean isArrayElementChanged(IPropertyReference<KeyableBean,Object[]> ref)
      Delegates to isArrayElementChanged(IArrayPropertyInfo), using the referenced property literal.
      boolean isFieldChanged(IPropertyReference<KeyableBean,Object> ref)
      Delegates to isFieldChanged(IEntityPropertyInfo), using the referenced property literal.
      boolean isTriggerAvailable(WorkflowTriggerKey triggerKey)
      True if the given trigger is available in the Workflow; i.e. if it is OK to pass the trigger ID to the invokeTrigger method
      String localizedBranchName(String stepId, String branchId, com.guidewire.commons.metadata.i18n.config.GWLanguage language)
      Returns the localized display name for the given branch in the given step in the given locale
      String localizedBranchName(String stepId, String branchId)
      Returns the localized display name for the given branch in the given step in the current locale

      Returns the localized display name for the given step in the current locale
      WorkflowLogEntry log(String summary, String description)
      Logs an item of information about the Workflow. The entry is returned in case you want to set additional fields on it.
      WorkflowLogEntry logAction(com.guidewire.pl.system.locale.DisplayKey key, Integer arg)
      Logs a display key so that an argument can be constructed.
      WorkflowLogEntry logAfterAction(String stepId, WorkflowActionType action, com.guidewire.pl.system.locale.DisplayKey key, Integer arg)
      Logs an action after the action has been accomplished, to recapture the step and action. Implementation note: the localization arguments ars are { Step, Action, arg }
      WorkflowLogEntry logText(com.guidewire.pl.system.locale.DisplayKey key, Integer arg, String summary, String description)
      Logs an item of information about the Workflow. The entry is returned in case you want to set additional fields on it. Implementation note: the localization arguments are { arg, summary }
      WorkflowLogEntry logUser(User user, com.guidewire.pl.system.locale.DisplayKey key, Integer arg)
      Logs a user action display key so that an argument can be constructed. Implementation note: the localization arguments args are {User, Arg}
      void removeFromActivities(Activity element)
      Removes an instance of entity.Activity from the Activities array.

      Removes an instance of entity.Activity having id elementID from the Activities array by retiring the element.

        WorkflowLogEntry log(String summary,
                   String description)
        Logs an item of information about the Workflow. The entry is returned in case you want to set additional fields on it.
        Parameters:
        summary - a short (about 10 word max) summary of what happened
        description - a longer description, which may include details like a stack trace
        Returns:
        the log entry

      • isTriggerAvailable

        boolean isTriggerAvailable(WorkflowTriggerKey triggerKey)
        True if the given trigger is available in the Workflow; i.e. if it is OK to pass the trigger ID to the invokeTrigger method
        Parameters:
        triggerKey -
        Returns:

      • invokeTrigger

        void invokeTrigger(WorkflowTriggerKey triggerKey,
                 boolean synchronous)
        Like {@link #invokeTrigger(WorkflowTriggerKey)} but with an extra parameter to control whether the trigger should be evaluated synchronously (i.e. immediately in the current bundle) or else in the background.
        Parameters:
        triggerKey -
        synchronous - if true, executes trigger immediately; otherwise in the background

      • invokeTrigger

        void invokeTrigger(WorkflowTriggerKey triggerKey)
        Tries to invoke a "manual trigger" in the Workflow, meaning an action initiated from outside the Workflow itself. In the case of an external Workflow, this will just update the "triggerInvoked" field; in the case of an internal Workflow it will set the "triggerInvoked" field and advance the workflow synchronously.

        This is equivalent to calling invokeTrigger(triggerKey, true)

        Parameters:
        triggerKey -

      • createSubFlow

        Workflow createSubFlow(Workflow type,
                     Integer version)
        Create and start a subflow of the specified version. If the subflow has a common super type, the common super type's properties are copied into the new workflow.
        Parameters:
        type - the type of subflow to create.
        version - the version
        Returns:
        the newly created and started subflow.

      • createSubFlow

        Workflow createSubFlow(Workflow type)
        Create and start a subflow. If the subflow has a common super type, the common super type's properties are copied into the new workflow.
        Parameters:
        type - the type of subflow to create.
        Returns:
        the newly created and started subflow.

      • instantiateSubFlow

        Workflow instantiateSubFlow(Workflow type)
        Create but do not start a subflow of the specified version. After you have finished populating the properties of the workflow you should either start or startAsynchronously (with the apporpiate version if desired) If the subflow has a common super type, the common super type's properties are copied into the new workflow.
        Parameters:
        type - the type of subflow to create.
        Returns:
        the newly created subflow.

      • logAfterAction

        WorkflowLogEntry logAfterAction(String stepId,
                              WorkflowActionType action,
                              com.guidewire.pl.system.locale.DisplayKey key,
                              Integer arg)
        Logs an action after the action has been accomplished, to recapture the step and action. Implementation note: the localization arguments ars are { Step, Action, arg }
        Parameters:
        stepId - the step being executed
        action - the action being executed
        key - the display key
        arg - a piece of information for the display key
        Returns:
        the log entry
